page.title: 10Entertainment in St. Agnes
page.content: Not having a cinema in St. Agnes, much of the entertainment is provided by the local residents. Young people of the Methodist Church stage a Christmas pantomime. The Theatre Players, with a workshop in Goonown, produce plays twice a year. These range from humorous to historic. At special events a street theatre may be seen, their production geared to fit the occasion. St. Agnes Singers give a variety of concerts and often visit nursing homes, local pubs, and senior citizens clubs providing a varied programme. During summer a visiting jester (in costume) provides live entertainment in local pubs. Accompanied on his lute-shaped guitar he renders a selection of Cornish favourites. Many organisations put on a hoe-down in winter months with a live band and a caller.
